docs.lead_paragraph: Under the new coding regime, government programs and private insurers will require doctors, hospitals, clinics and nursing homes to report vastly more information about the care they provide patients.

headline.main: One Symptom in New Medical Codes: Doctor Anxiety
headline.print_headline: One Symptom in New Codes: Doctor Anxiety

docs.abstract: Health care providers across United States are increasingly anxious about introduction of more than 100,000 new codes they will be required to use; codes were drawn up according to 10th revision of International Classification of Disease and must be used starting in October; codes could compel doctors to make more in-depth assessments of patients, but providers worry transitioning to new system will lead to some claims and payments being denied or delayed.
docs.snippet: Under the new coding regime, government programs and private insurers will require doctors, hospitals, clinics and nursing homes to report vastly more information about the care they provide patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study finds that bringing blood pressure down below current recommendations may greatly reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.

headline.main: Lower Blood Pressure Guidelines Could Be ‘Lifesaving,’ Federal Study Says
headline.print_headline: Study Testing Blood Pressure Says Go Lower

docs.abstract: Study conducted by National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute suggests people can lower their risk of heart attack and stroke by reducing blood pressure to below 120 rather than current guideline of 140; data will be published in next few months.
docs.snippet: A new study finds that bringing blood pressure down below current recommendations may greatly reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.

keywords.value: National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A House subcommittee is investigating competition in the industry and how it would be affected by mergers combining Aetna with Humana and Anthem with Cigna.

headline.main: House Hearing on Insurers’ Mergers Exposes Health Care Industry Divide
headline.print_headline: House Hearing on Insurer Mega-Mergers Bares Health Care Industry Divide

docs.abstract: House Judiciary subcommittee investigating competition in health insurance industry hears conflicting testimony about benefits of corporate mergers proposed by Aetna, Humana, Anthem and Cigna; lobbyists for industry say consolidations would lower costs and promote competition, but experts on health care and antitrust laws harshly criticize proposed mergers as a potential concentration of market power that could not easily be undone.
docs.snippet: A House subcommittee is investigating competition in the industry and how it would be affected by mergers combining Aetna with Humana and Anthem with Cigna.

keywords.value: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A hard-fought measure to legalize physician-assisted suicide in California cleared the state Assembly on Wednesday despite opposition from religious groups and advocates for the disabled, and moved to the state Senate, where it was widely expected to gain final passage.

headline.main: Assisted-Suicide Bill Approved by California Assembly
headline.print_headline: Assisted-Suicide Bill Approved by California Assembly

docs.snippet: A hard-fought measure to legalize physician-assisted suicide in California cleared the state Assembly on Wednesday despite opposition from religious groups and advocates for the disabled, and moved to the state Senate, where it was widely expected to...

docs.lead_paragraph: The state Assembly approved legislation Wednesday that would allow terminally ill patients to legally end their lives after an emotional and deeply personal debate, sending the proposal to the Senate that is expected to endorse it.
docs.snippet: The state Assembly approved legislation Wednesday that would allow terminally ill patients to legally end their lives after an emotional and deeply personal debate, sending the proposal to the Senate that is expected to endorse it.
